result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra R Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Disburse Restitution

for restitution in the amount of $60.93
FINANCIAL NOTES: $490 pd via GPS. (Needs to be paid over to DOC)

[MK] case called at 3:44pm. 
Defendant Cassandra R Davis in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent Perchell Simmons appears by telephone.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
ADA Teuber argues in support of Probation extension, noting that Ms. Davis has not paid any amount on the restitution that is due. 
Cassandra Davis- sworn & testifies
--examination by the Court 
Mr. Davis indicates that she is prepared to pay $511 today by credit card payment.
The Court finds that there has not been a good faith effort to pay during the course of Probation.  
The Court orders Ms. Davis to make the $511 payment to the Clerk of Courts Office today.  The Court directs the Clerk of Courts to accept payment of the $511 amount on the restitution and court costs.  
The clerk is to distribute to The Children's Place the amount of $60.93, and the balance is to be transferred to the DOC Cashier for application on the remaining costs and fees that are due, unless the Clerk and the DOC agree to a different method for application of the funds.
The Court orders that, upon receiving confirmation that the $511 has been paid over, then Ms. Davis can be discharged from Probation as scheduled; and that any remaining amount thereafter shall be converted to a civil judgment. 
recess 3:54pm. 
[Clerk MK provides a copy of these minutes to the Clerk of Courts Office Bookkeeping division.]
Probation review hearing on March 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
DOC Balance Inquiry

under advisement-- to be decided at 11:00 am today

Case called at 11:04am [mo]
Defendant Cassandra R Davis in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain current employment; the Court clarifies that termination from employment is a violation of bond, lay off is NOT a violation
--shall Ms. Davis be layed off from her current position at General Mills, she is to attempt to find new employment immediately
--no presence at Johnson Creek outlet mall
--to pay $60.93 in restitution to Children's Place
--to pay statutory costs

Atty. Hagemann indicates that the amount of restitution is not disputed
The Court finds that Ms. Davis has the ability to pay $60.93 over the course of probation

Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 11:30am
for Continuance of the presently scheduled sentencing hearing on 4-22-2016 at 11:00 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference at 05-10-2016 09:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 03-23-2016 03:00 pm

Case called at 2:28pm [mo]
Defendant Cassandra R Davis in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Ms. Davis indicates that she would like counsel

The Court directs Ms. Davis to go to the Jefferson SPD office.
The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall in the Village of Johnson Creek
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
